2.text: Melt 1⁄2 cup (120 mL) of coconut oil in a small pot over low heat.

3.text: Add 4 tbsp (59 mL) of honey and ½ tbsp (7.4 mL) of vanilla extract.

4.text: Sift in 1 cup (100 g) of cocoa powder gradually.

5.text: Take the chocolate off of the heat and continue stirring it as it thickens.

6.text: Transfer the warm chocolate to a nonstick surface to cool.

7.text: Refrigerate your chocolate for 1 hour before enjoying it.

8.text: Create a makeshift double boiler using a pot of water and a mixing bowl.

9.text: Melt ¾ cup (140 g) of cocoa butter in the heated mixing bowl.

10.text: Sift ¾ cup (80 g) of cocoa powder into the melted cocoa butter.

11.text: Shake in ¼ cup of milk powder and 1 cup (100 g) of confectioner’s sugar.

12.text: Remove the bowl from the heat and stir the chocolate until it thickens.

13.text: Pour the chocolate onto a nonstick surface or into a candy mold.

14.text: Let your chocolate harden in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
